name: Ydinaseeton Pohjola - Onko Suomi Usattunut/Demokratia 7"
description:
Pressing 101 copies on black vinyl

Release itself is not in any way essential, but I like the versions and didn't want to throw those songs away. Thus this kind of small pressing.

name: Armless Children / Ydinaseeton Pohjola - 6 Tracks Split EP
description:
Here you'll get such an rå mangel attack that your brains will melt. Finally these children's live energy is captured on wax. If you liked their 1st EP, you'll love this one. 2 d-beat mayhems and Tatuerade Snutkukar cover. DIE LOUD!

On the other side Ydinaseeton Pohjola offers their own version what raw punk should sound like. Two originals recorded same time as split LP with Aokigahara and The Comes cover.

Double sided A3 sized foldout sleeves and obi. Pressing 500 copies, 100 on red and 400 on black vinyl.
The red one is SOLD OUT!

name: Ydinaseeton Pohjola / Aokigahara - Split LP (Red vinyl + CD-R)
description: Ydinaseeton Pohjola is continuing its raw punk crusade of the old Italian and Spanish bands. Waves of distortion and feedback, retarted screaming and shouting, forced wretched riffs and very strong sociopolitical message. Put barbed wire to your left ear and pull it out from the right ear. Enjoy the feeling! Aokigahara music is heavily influenced by old Japanese hardcore/punk such as Zouo, GISM and LSD. Expect harsh vocals, heavy distorted bass, pounding drums and melodic guitar with metal influences weaving dark overall sound. This all fits well to post-apocalyptic visions of lyrical content. Listen whole Ydinaseeton Pohjola side Listen 2 Aokigahara tracks This is special mailorder only version on red vinyl with silverprinted extra cover and bonus live in "studio" Ydinaseeton Pohjola CD-R

name: Ydinaseeton Pohjola / Aokigahara - Split LP (Black vinyl)
description: Ydinaseeton Pohjola is continuing its raw punk crusade of the old Italian and Spanish bands. Waves of distortion and feedback, retarted screaming and shouting, forced wretched riffs and very strong sociopolitical message. Put barbed wire to your left ear and pull it out from the right ear. Enjoy the feeling! Aokigahara music is heavily influenced by old Japanese hardcore/punk such as Zouo, GISM and LSD. Expect harsh vocals, heavy distorted bass, pounding drums and melodic guitar with metal influences weaving dark overall sound. This all fits well to post-apocalyptic visions of lyrical content. Listen whole Ydinaseeton Pohjola side Listen 2 Aokigahara tracks

name: Ydinaseeton Pohjola - S/T 12"
description: One sided 12 inch record. 299 copies made. One epic, one riff, over 4 minutes long crusher, one cover song  and 10 minute manifestos. Waves  of distortion and feedback, retarted screaming and shouting, forced wretched riffs and very strong sociopolitical message.

name: Rajoitus / Kylmä Sota - Split EP
description: New split 7" from these great hardcore groups from Finland and Sweden!

name: Armless Children - 5 track EP
description: D-beat mayhem!!!

name: Maailmanloppu - Valtaa EP
description: The latest EP from this excellent Finnish hc/punk band!!!  These 4 song are recorded in the same sessions as "post punk" 7" released earlier this year. These songs are more in the vein of their debut LPs raging hardcore.

name: 1981 - Cycle / Symptom 7"
description: Brand new 2 track ep from Finland's 1981, self released on the drummers own label, Profiteer. Brilliantly written anarcho punk with pop sensibilities all over.Definitely one for fans of Zounds and early Chumbawamba.Avoid this is you want brutal hardcore, devour this if you want great tunes. ﻿

name: Konkurssi - s/t EP
description:
Maximum Rocknroll #347:
"Like all proper raw punk lovers, I have an abiding affection for classic '80's Finnish punk, but the more modern stuff has been very hit or miss to me (KIELTOLAKI obviously excluded, of course). KONKURSSI are right up my fucking alley though! Sloppy as fuck C-beat fast hardcore with MOB 47 influences firmly in place, though the tempo does take its foot off the gas at times, resulting in an early RIISTETYT feel. These six songs sound like these kids were drunk as fuck in the studio, not in a bad way but in the sense there's a real looseness and live feel that very few studio recordings can pull off. The lyrics are bleak and nihilistic, but are leavened with a very refreshing sense of humor as well. I think "Six Pack" is the first pro-beer gut song I've ever heard. This isn't a game-changer, but it's a fucking solid EP of classic Scandinavian hardcore fucking punk. (AU)"

name: Kaivosurma - Revisionistit EP
description:
Four great new songs! Crazy Finnish Hardcore! Limited to only 200 copies!

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EDTo6Oyo1o8

name: White Tears - Reagan Rises From The Grave EP
description:
White Tears play absolutely traditional three-chord hardcore; the songs last for one minute, use the traditional verse/chorus/verse/chorus-formula, and are as fast, angry and played as intensively as you'd expect from a young group of punks. The overall sound is harsh, powerful and raw, but by no means lo-fi. The vocals are served as low shouts that stand out from the music in a good way, and the hate-filled lyrics' pronounciation makes them rather easy to follow.

http://soundcloud.com/white-tears/white-tears-reagan-rises-from

http://soundcloud.com/white-tears/white-tears-nothing-to-gain

name: Horros - Iron Birds EP
description:
Three songs of heavy crust with raw sounds.
released by Face Your Gods and K.Tuotanto (Japan).
Listen to a sample song here: http://horrosband.bandcamp.com/track/fallen-cities

name: Deadsunrise - S/T LP
description: Deadsunrise definitely taking a few cues from the His Hero is Gone school both vocally and musically, but there's more to it than that, and this is by no means another copycat band. Absolutely churning hardcore/punk that mixes faster tempos and bludgeoning slow riffs blending straightforward chord progressions with discordant metal riffing. Total northern angst and misery!

name: Deadsunrise - Several Casualties 7"
description: Deadsunrise definitely taking a few cues from the His Hero is Gone school both vocally and musically, but there's more to it than that, and this is by no means another copycat band. Absolutely churning hardcore/punk that mixes faster tempos and bludgeoning slow riffs blending straightforward chord progressions with discordant metal riffing. Total northern angst and misery!

name: Pahaa Verta - S/T 7"EP
description: Raging Finnish HC right here... I found 3 copies from bottom of distrobox.

name: Pahaa Verta - S/T LP
description: Self titled LP from this band from Kouvola, Finland. "Who has time to play fucking games? This band clearly doesn't and they waste no time in ripping into this fourteen-track rager. PAHAA VERTA hails from Finland and pounds out some nasty tunes with that Finnish hardcore thing going plus more of a US hardcore influence happening. What makes this a winner is solid songwriting with the instantly-recognizable Finnish vocal style, and it is delivered with rasp and rage and wins me over instantly. Great! "(Martin Sorrondeguy, MMR #328)

name: Brutopia / Lähdön Aika - Split EP
description: Brutopia strikes you down with three bursts of classic d-beat in the vein of Discharge and Disfear. Lähdön aika plays slow and depressive crustcore. Features new songs plus Brutopia covering Lähdon aika and vice versa.

name: Kuolema ‎– Viinaa Aineita Naisia 2001-2008 CD
description:
To paraphrase Kuolema’s MySpace biography, ‘this band plays really fast Finnish hardcore. The band formed in 1981, broke up four years later and got back together in 2001’.

Viina Aineita Naisia 2001-2008 naturally includes six different recordings. The first three songs comes from a 2007 session and shows a band dishing out some pretty edgy punk rock. 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EgyeIqGDVVE

name: Remissions -7"EP
description:
Great metallic hardcore from Finland!

300 copies made.

name: Remissions -10"
description: Great metallic hardcore from Finland!

name: Hävitys - Ei paluuta 7"EP
description: Very well done crust/grind.
